sbol:Collection.dcterms:title: iGEM Parts Registry
sbol:Collection.dcterms:description: The iGEM Registry is a growing collection of genetic parts that can be mixed and matched to build synthetic biology devices and systems. As part of the synthetic biology community's efforts to make biology easier to engineer, it provides a source of genetic parts to iGEM teams and academic labs.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K2081000
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
There are three proteins including thyroxine-binding globulin (TBG), transthyretin and albumin responsible for carrying the thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and 3,5,3'-triiodothyronine (T3) in the bloodstream. This gene encodes the major thyroid hormone transport protein, TBG, in serum. It belongs to the serpin family in genomics, but the protein has no inhibitory function like many other members of the serpin family. Mutations in this gene result in TGB deficiency, which has been classified as partial deficiency, complete deficiency, and excess, based on the level of serum TBG. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found, but the full-length nature of these variants has not been determined.
References:
AUTHORS Ferrara AM, Pappa T, Fu J, Brown CD, Peterson A, Moeller LC, Wyne K, White KP, Pluzhnikov A, Trubetskoy V, Nobrega M, Weiss RE, Dumitrescu AM and Refetoff S. TITLE JOURNAL J. Clin. Endocrinol. Metab. 100 (1), E173-E181 (2015)
AUTHORS Yan Z, Yan H and Ou H. TITLE Human thyroxine binding globulin (TBG) promoter directs efficient and sustaining transgene expression in liver-specific pattern JOURNAL Gene 506 (2), 289-294 (2012)
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Rafael Rojas Obreg??n
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance:
TBG complete sequence for plasmid insertion (with Ecor1, Xba1, T4, LacO, RBS: BBA J61110,terminator:BBA_B0015, SPE1, PST)

sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: We had to take into account what restriction enzymes could be used in order to further engineer the composed plasmid. We used Xba1, EcoR 1, Spe! and Pst1 because they are compatible with the rest of the plasmids in the registry.
